comments:
Can be reproduce using wtp.jsf's facesconfig editor but the problem seems happen on everyone who uses the EMF model.

1. Download everything required by the wtp.jsf 1.5.1.
2. Launch eclipse
3. Create a dynamic web project
4. Copy or create a faces-config.xml under WEB-INF folder
5. Open the file using facesconfig editor.
6. Open the file again using a text editor.
7. In the facesconfig editor, add two managed-bean on the managed-bean page.
8. Switch to the text editor, delete those two managed beans together, save the file.
9. Switch to the facesconfig editor
Problem: you will see the second managed bean is still displayed.
10. Add another managed bean.
Problem: the following exception will be added in errors log view:

org.eclipse.emf.common.util.WrappedException: An exception was ignored during command execution

Similar problem happens when using IBM's web.xml editor:
1. Open web.xml using web.xml editor
2. Open web.xml using the text editor
3. Switch to web.xml editor, and add two "welcome pages" on the "Pages" tab, Save the file.
4. Switch to the text editor, and delete all the welcome pages, save the file.
5. Switch back to the web.xml editor, go to the "Pages" tab
Problem: not all the welcome pages have been deleted.
6. Add another welcome page, and you will see the same exception.

Using this bug for 1.5.5... have a solution delivered in WTP 2.0.1...

https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=192468
Have tested this patch with junits - and it does fix this issue, as well as others like it.....
Approved. Will this be fixed on the 2.0.x/3.0 stream too?
Yes!  Dropping fix to 155 and 201(30) streams...
